pr_title: [#2125] Support tenant specific configuration of timeoutToAck

timeline.message:
[#2125] Support tenant specific configuration of timeoutToAck

The CoAP adapter now supports the configiuration of the timeoutToAck
property at the tenant level. If not specified, the value set at the
adapter level is used.

Fixes #2125

Signed-off-by: Kai Hudalla <kai.hudalla@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText:
Given a JSON string with the "timeoutToAck" value set to something <= Integer.MAX_VALUE, this will lead to a ClassCastException because the Map value will be an Integer, not a Long. Using the primitive long type for the cast would work.
Besides that, I think it would be better to deal with a possible configuration error here, the "timeoutToAck" value being defined as a String for example. For the standard TenantObject fields, we deal with that gracefully, catching ClassCastExceptions via JsonHelper.getValue. I think for extension values, we should do the same, so that there can't be any ClassCastException thrown here.
